peam
Friday, August 11th, 2017, 9:27:26 AM

I should have posted this earlier in the thread, but for those of you not in the know, Peter Chang is a big deal in the culinary world. Before opening the handful of restaurants and staying put in the VA area, he had a reputation for working somewhere long enough to establish a reputation and moving on. There was even a group dedicated to letting people know where he was working.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/chef-peter-chang-settles-down-with-richmond-area-restaurant/2012/02/09/gIQAPsFY2Qstory.html?utmterm=.63a8cbdabc67

https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/food/how-chef-peter-chang-stopped-running-and-started-empire-building/2015/03/16/66ff2378-c750-11e4-aa1a-86135599fb0fstory.html?utmterm=.962e1b3a42b1

https://www.styleweekly.com/richmond/peter-chang-an-interview-with-richmonds-most-mysterious-chef/Content?oid=2328818

http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2010/03/01/wheres-chang

@sabotage said in VA meetup in Fredricksburg:

@0zymandius Have you been there before, do they have rooms for gatherings?

I've been there a dozen times or more. It's a very wide open area, but no special rooms. I'm hoping to "reserve" a corner of the restaurant, though. We probably won't have anything like real privacy, but we should be comfortable. I've never been there and seen it more than half full (it really is a pretty sizeable area). Friday evenings it might be a bit more crowded, which is why I'm planning on stopping in and seeing if I can make arrangements for us.

Of note: They close at 10 on Friday nights. I'm not sure if we want to have a second destination in mind? Maybe something akin to a 'bar'? Just thinking out loud here...

Of Second note: They have a 20% off coupon on their website for any dinner only orders that surpass $40.00. I'll probably print out one of these for everyone, as that's a pretty healthy deal.
